current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the National Trails System Act to provide for
		  the study of the Pike National Historic Trail.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Pike National Historic Trail Study Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5(c) of the National Trails System
			 Act

text.#text:
The Pike National Historic Trail, a series of
				routes extending approximately 3,664 miles, which follows the route taken by
				Lt. Zebulon Montgomery Pike during the 1806–1807 Pike expedition that began in
				Fort Bellefontaine, Missouri, extended through portions of the States of
				Kansas, Nebraska, Colorado, New Mexico, and Texas, and ended in Natchitoches,
				Louisiana.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S524 IS: Pike National Historic Trail Study Act of 2013
